title: China × Philippines Military Clash
description: Polymarket traders price a 17% chance of a direct military encounter between Chinese and Philippine armed forces before 2027. Ongoing PLA Navy and Coast Guard harassment near Second Thomas Shoal continues despite US reaffirmation of Mutual Defense Treaty obligations. A ramming incident causing hull damage to a military vessel would qualify.

title: China × Taiwan Military Clash
description: Markets price a 15% probability of a kinetic military clash between China and Taiwan before end of 2026. PLA air incursions into Taiwan's ADIZ have averaged over 10 sorties per day. A military clash is defined as direct exchange of fire, missile strikes, or intentional warship ramming causing significant damage.

title: China Invades Taiwan by End of 2026
description: Polymarket prices a full Chinese invasion of Taiwan at 10% before end of 2026, with $9.1M in trading volume making it one of the most liquid geopolitical markets. PLA amphibious capabilities, logistics constraints, and the cost of economic isolation act as the primary deterrents. US posture in the Pacific remains the key swing variable.

title: China Blockades Taiwan by June 2026
description: A 6% market probability on a Chinese naval blockade of Taiwan by June 30, 2026 backed by $547K in volume. A blockade would halt ~$600B in annual chip exports and trigger Article V consultations with US treaty partners. PLA naval exercises in the strait have increased in frequency and scope since late 2024.

title: Thailand–Cambodia Military Strike
description: Polymarket prices a 25% probability that Thailand strikes Cambodia again by June 30, 2026. The July 2025 Thai strikes near the Preah Vihear temple — the highest-volume Asia market ($15M) in Polymarket history — resolved Yes. A ceasefire held through August 2025 but cross-border artillery incidents have resumed.

title: China × India Military Clash
description: Markets price a 14% probability of a Chinese-Indian military clash by December 31, 2026. The LAC remains tense following the 2020 Galwan Valley clashes. Both sides have significantly reinforced forward positions in Aksai Chin and Arunachal Pradesh. A clash here would disrupt Indian Ocean supply chains critical to ASEAN trade.

title: Trump Visits China
description: Markets price a 94% probability that Trump visits China by April 30, 2026 — reflecting near-certainty after a confirmed diplomatic invitation following the October 2025 Mar-a-Lago Trump-Xi summit. A visit would likely include tariff reduction talks, potential Taiwan assurances, and South China Sea behavioral agreements.

title: Xi Meets Taiwan's Cheng Li-wun
description: A 33% market probability ($201K volume) that Xi Jinping meets Taiwan opposition leader Cheng Li-wun by June 30, 2026. Such a meeting would mark the first cross-strait political dialogue since 2015 and potentially signal a softening of PRC posture ahead of the 2026 Taiwan local elections.

title: Lai Ching-te Ousted as Taiwan President
description: Markets price a 22% probability that Lai Ching-te leaves the Taiwan presidency in 2026. An ongoing impeachment push from the KMT-TPP legislative majority — driven by disputes over the defense budget and cross-strait policy — is the primary mechanism. Ousting requires 2/3 legislative vote plus a public referendum.

title: KMT Wins 2026 Taiwan Local Elections
description: The Kuomintang is priced at 88% to win the most heads of local government in Taiwan's 2026 local elections. A KMT sweep would give Beijing its most favorable Taiwanese interlocutor since Ma Ying-jeou and could accelerate cross-strait economic re-engagement — with significant downstream effects on ASEAN trade routing.

title: China Coup Attempt Before 2027
description: Polymarket prices a 5% chance of a coup attempt in China before end of 2026. Elevated by the high-profile purges of PLA Rocket Force commanders and the mysterious absence of multiple senior officials in 2023-24. Xi's consolidation of power remains firm, but internal elite dissatisfaction with economic performance is a latent risk.

title: China Lifts Rare Earth Export Controls
description: China's 2024 rare earth export restrictions on gallium, germanium and antimony — targeting US defense and semiconductor supply chains — resolved with a partial lift in late 2025 (Yes on Polymarket). Current question: whether full normalisation follows. ASEAN nations are actively positioning as alternative rare earth processors.

title: Myanmar Junta Territorial Collapse
description: The Three Brotherhood Alliance and CRPH resistance forces now control an estimated 60%+ of Myanmar's territory. The SAC junta's hold on Rakhine, Shan and Kachin states has fractured. A formal collapse of central government control over border regions would trigger refugee flows exceeding 2M and disrupt China's BRI corridor investments.

title: Vietnam–China Trade Agreement
description: A Vietnam-China bilateral trade deal resolved Yes on Polymarket in May 2025 ($106K volume). Vietnam's trade surplus with China has grown to $80B annually. Follow-on negotiations focus on rare earth processing rights, EV supply chain integration, and preferential port access at Haiphong — raising strategic dependency concerns.

title: South China Sea UNCLOS Tribunal Ruling
description: An anticipated UNCLOS arbitration ruling on the nine-dash line and Philippine EEZ rights is expected mid-2026. The 2016 ruling — which Beijing rejected — established precedent. A new ruling reaffirming Philippine sovereign rights could trigger PLA naval escalation and prompt ASEAN to formally condemn Chinese expansionism.

title: Indonesia Joins BRICS
description: Polymarket prices Indonesia joining BRICS at 78% before end of 2026. Prabowo Subianto signalled intent at the October 2025 Kazan summit, and Indonesia submitted a formal application in January 2026. Membership would significantly shift ASEAN's economic centre of gravity toward Beijing and Moscow and complicate US-Indonesia defense cooperation under the 2023 IPEF framework.

title: Malaysia PM Anwar Ibrahim Ousted
description: Markets price a 19% chance that Anwar Ibrahim leaves the prime ministership before end of 2026. His unity government coalition commands a thin parliamentary majority prone to defections. A Bersatu-led no-confidence motion backed by GRS Sabah and Sarawak GPS — which together hold 45 seats — is the most plausible path to government collapse.

title: Philippines Terminates VFA with US
description: A 12% market probability that the Philippines terminates or suspends the Visiting Forces Agreement with the United States before end of 2026. Pro-Beijing factions within the Philippine Senate have tabled resolutions citing sovereignty concerns. Termination would remove US forward basing rights and significantly weaken deterrence along the first island chain.

title: Singapore GDP Growth Misses 2% in 2026
description: Polymarket prices a 38% chance that Singapore's 2026 full-year GDP growth falls below 2%, reflecting risk of a global trade contraction. Singapore's open economy — with trade at 320% of GDP — is acutely exposed to US tariff escalation, semiconductor demand softness, and any disruption to the Strait of Malacca throughput affecting $3.4T in annual shipping.

title: Thailand PM Paetongtarn Ousted
description: Markets price a 44% chance that Paetongtarn Shinawatra is removed from Thailand's prime ministership before end of 2026. The Constitutional Court accepted a petition alleging ethical violations tied to the Shinawatra family's ongoing interference in government — mirroring the legal mechanisms used to remove her predecessors Yingluck and Thaksin.

title: Vietnam South China Sea Oil Clash
description: A 21% probability that Vietnamese and Chinese vessels clash at the Vanguard Bank oil exploration block before end of 2026. PetroVietnam's Block 06-01 drilling — located within China's nine-dash line claim — has twice triggered CSCL vessel harassment. A kinetic incident here would spike Brent crude and disrupt LNG flows through the Strait of Malacca.

title: Cambodia Hun Manet Consolidates Power
description: Markets price an 82% chance that Hun Manet fully consolidates control over the Cambodian People's Party apparatus by end of 2026, marginalising residual loyalists of his father Hun Sen. Key indicators: CPP Congress composition, removal of Hun Sen allies from Interior Ministry posts, and Cambodia's tilt away from China toward a hedged ASEAN posture.

title: Typhoon Season Disrupts Philippine Ports
description: A 67% probability that at least one Category 5 typhoon makes landfall in Luzon between June–November 2026, causing >$2B in damage and halting Manila port operations for 10+ days. Philippine typhoon landfalls have averaged 20 per year with increasing intensification. Manila port handles 40% of Philippine container volume — a disruption would ripple through regional supply chains.

title: Mekong River Hits Critical Low
description: A 58% probability that the Mekong River falls to critically low levels (below 2m at Chiang Saen gauge) during the 2026 dry season due to upstream Chinese dam operations and below-average monsoon. Such an event would devastate fisheries across Laos, Thailand, Cambodia, and Vietnam — threatening food security for 70M people and accelerating upstream-downstream political friction.

title: Indonesia General Strike Over Tariffs
description: Markets price a 29% probability of a nationwide general strike in Indonesia before end of 2026, triggered by rising cost-of-living from US tariff retaliations affecting Indonesian commodity exports. Palm oil, coal, and nickel exports — which together account for 34% of export earnings — face compounding headwinds from both US and EU carbon border adjustment mechanisms.
